result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaw Pierre Herbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including the Nurturing program through Washington County Family Center. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 

Defendant shall comply with all orders in 22JC25A. 

Defendant shall only have contact with C.R.H. per the terms and orders issued in 22JC25A unless modified by the probation agent. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Victim's mother also present; Joint recommendation; No contest plea entered on Ct 1; Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1, defendant is convicted and sentenced. Victim's mother makes statements; Argument on sentencing.  Statements from defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shaw Pierre Herbert in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Shaw Pierre Herbert. Victim present.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.  Counsel indicates CHIPS action will be filed and def has consented to safety plan. Court sets $1000 signature bond. Court enters NG plea on behalf of def.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
